original_data.question: A 31-year-old woman comes to the physician because of a 5-month history of intermittent flank pain. Over the past 2 years, she has had five urinary tract infections. Her blood pressure is 150/88 mm Hg. Physical examination shows bilateral, nontender upper abdominal masses. Serum studies show a urea nitrogen concentration of 29 mg/dL and a creatinine concentration of 1.4 mg/dL. Renal ultrasonography shows bilaterally enlarged kidneys with multiple parenchymal anechoic masses. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

model_response:
The findings are typical for autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease. The disease is characterized by the presence of fluid-filled cysts in the kidney. The cysts are usually bilateral and may be found in the coex and medulla. The disease is progressive, leading to renal failure in middle to late adulthood. Hypertension is common. The other choices do not give the bilateral manifestations seen in this patient.

Answer: OPTION B IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: Record and study of past events.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
Inflammatory responses of the epithelium of the URINARY TRACT to microbial invasions. They are often bacterial infections with associated BACTERIURIA and PYURIA.
PRESSURE of the BLOOD on the ARTERIES and other BLOOD VESSELS.
Systematic and thorough inspection of the patient for physical signs of disease or abnormality.
Affecting both sides of the body or a matched pair of organs.
An abnormal growth in the abdomen.
The study of serum, especially of antigen-antibody reactions in vitro.
The breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function.
The act or process of concentrating, focusing the attention and mental energy on a single object to the exclusion of others.

The visualization of deep structures of the body by recording the reflections or echoes of ultrasonic pulses directed into the tissues. Use of ultrasound for imaging or diagnostic purposes employs frequencies ranging from 1.6 to 10 megahertz.
Body organ that filters blood for the secretion of URINE and that regulates ion concentrations.
An indefinite large quantity that is considered to be greater than several.

The determination of the nature of a disease or condition, or the distinguishing of one disease or condition from another. Assessment may be made through physical examination, laboratory tests, or the likes. Computerized programs may be used to enhance the decision-making process.
